question: Which IAM entity is best suited for granting temporary access to AWS resources for applications running on EC2 instances?
An IAM user must manage only Amazon S3 buckets. Which action will achieve the principle of least privilege?
options: Attach a custom policy allowing only s3:* actions
Make the user part of the PowerUser group

question: Which TWO are true about IAM policies? (Choose TWO)
options: Policies can be attached to groups
Policies can be attached to IAM roles
Policies can be attached directly to EC2 instances
Policies can deny as well as allow access
Policies cannot be attached to IAM users

question: Which IAM feature allows enforcing Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) before performing specific actions like deleting S3 buckets?
Which TWO statements about IAM roles are correct? (Choose TWO)
options: Roles are used by trusted entities
Roles can be assumed by AWS services
Roles can only be assigned to users
Roles can provide temporary security credentials
